TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataObjectFieldAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Provides metadata for a property representing a data field. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> attribute to provide information about the schema of the underlying data. Design-time classes such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceDesigner> class use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectAttribute> attribute to set properties at design-time based on the exposed schema.
You apply the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> attribute to members of the data item objects that are returned by the Select method of an object marked with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectAttribute> attribute. In the following example, the `NorthwindData` class is marked with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectAttribute> attribute, and returns an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> object containing `NorthwindEmployee` objects from the `GetAllEmployees` method. Fields in the `NorthwindEmployee` class are marked with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> attribute to indicate they represent data fields in the underlying data source.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/30386922-1e00-4602-9ebf-526b271a8b87).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how you can apply the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> to a publicly exposed property to identify metadata associated with the property. In this example the `NorthwindEmployee` type exposes three data properties: `EmployeeID`, `FirstName`, and `LastName`. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> attribute is applied to all three properties; however, only the `EmployeeID` property attribute indicates it is the primary key for the data row.
[!code-csharp[System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute/CS/dataobjectmethodattribute.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute/VB/dataobjectmethodattribute.vb#2)]

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how you can apply the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> to a publicly exposed property to identify metadata associated with the property. In this example the `NorthwindEmployee` type exposes three data properties: `EmployeeID`, `FirstName`, and `LastName`. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> attribute is applied to all three properties; however, only the `EmployeeID` property attribute indicates it is the primary key for the data row.
[!code-csharp[System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute/CS/dataobjectmethodattribute.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.ComponentModel.DataObjectMethodAttribute/VB/dataobjectmethodattribute.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method determines whether this instance of <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> fits the pattern of another object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
Gets a value indicating whether a property represents an identity field in the underlying data.
Docs.value: if the property represents an identity field in the underlying data; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute.IsIdentity%2A> property to `true` when the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> attribute is applied to a property that represents an identity field in the underlying data store. Typically an identity field is generated by the data store and uniquely identifies an entity in the data store.
Set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute.IsIdentity%2A> property with one of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> constructors.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a property represents a field that can be null in the underlying data store.
Docs.value: if the property represents a field that can be null in the underlying data store; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute.IsNullable%2A> property to `true` when then <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> attribute is applied to a property that represents a field in the underlying data store that can be set to null. The value that represents null in the data store may be different from `null` in the programming language.
Set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute.IsNullable%2A> property with one of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> constructors.

Docs.summary: Gets the length of the property in bytes.
Docs.value: The length of the property in bytes, or -1 if not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute.Length%2A> property to the length, in bytes, of the data from the underlying data store. If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute.Length%2A> property is not set, it will be -1.
Set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute.Length%2A> property with one of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> constructors.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a property is in the primary key in the underlying data.
Docs.value: if the property is in the primary key of the data store; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute.PrimaryKey%2A> property to `true` when the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> attribute is applied to a property that represents the primary key value of the underlying data. The primary key is typically used by the underlying data store to uniquely identify an entity in the data store, and often is, but is not required to be, a data store identity field.
Set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute.PrimaryKey%2A> property with one of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> constructors.
